Ratings.comment: He is a very smart professor and I think he explains things very well. He is always there when you need help and will do whatever he can to help you. He really cares and wants students to well. But, he is pretty hard. His exams were really tough and he would give the hardest problems. But they were still fair problems, just really tough

Listen this guy right here won't make stuff easy for you. You need to come in, pay attention, and work for it. He is there 258 for help so you go to his office and ask him about everything you don't get. Don't be an idiot and blame him when you aren't at his office hours and don't seek help.

He made thermodynamics pretty understandable. If you ever have a question on the homework, he is very helpful during office hours. The quizzes and exams were normally prettyy similar to homework problems and lecture examples.

I loved Dr. Fife. She was a very down to earth professor who really wants her students to succeed before and after graduation. She is extremely caring and will do whatever she can to help you. Her class was a little dry but it was fluid mechanics so I can't blame her for that. She's not an easy A, but if you put the time in, you'll get a good grade

I took fluids with Dr. Fife, and she was always upbeat, and caring during lecture. She can get off topic occasionally, but knows what she is talking about. She was a very fair grader, and gave a decent amount of grade wiggle room, with easily graded group projects. All exams were open note, and the final was optional. Make sure to take good notes.
Shes annoying and take FOREVER to grade

Dr. Fife was not always very clear with the assignment requirements. Once asked questions, she will explain much more thoroughly. The lectures were often long, which was partially because of all of the presentations. It's hard to sit through presentations, when you don't like the projects. Hopefully, this will change for the upcoming fall.
